ai.summary: Loch of Brouster is a short, easy 3.6 km hike in the UK around a tranquil freshwater loch. The trail suits beginners and families, offering gentle, well-trodden paths and scenic views of water and countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows mostly flat or gently rolling grassy tracks around the loch. Expect occasional uneven ground, small exposed roots, and damp or muddy patches near the shoreline. Shade is limited, so wear sun protection and sturdy footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Check local conditions before you go. Stick to the defined paths, be mindful of boggy areas after rain, and wear sturdy footwear. Bring a map or GPS, carry water and snacks, and tell someone your plans. Watch for livestock or other trail users and dress for changing UK weather.
recommended_gear: Light waterproof jacket and layered clothing
Map and/or GPS or smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) for the best conditions; winter visits are possible but may be cold, wet and more exposed.

seo.title: Loch of Brouster – Easy 3.6 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Enjoy an easy 3.6 km loop around Loch of Brouster. This family-friendly UK hike features gentle terrain, scenic loch views, and practical safety tips.
